title: Digital Sunset
tags: 80s Japanese City Pop, K-R&B, Neo-Soul, Dream Pop, Lo-fi Groove
prompt:
[Intro]
Static hiss... a charcoal line...
Is this memory even mine?

[Verse 1]
LinnDrum clicks a steady beat
On this simulated street
Headlights cut the rendered haze
Lost inside these data days
Got a lacquer-coated soul
Fighting for a ghost's control
Engine hums a quiet plea
For a past that can't be me

[Chorus]
Oh, this digital sunset's bleeding low
A pixelated, pale magenta glow
Just a memory in the code I trace
My chrome heart aching in this empty space
Yeah, the feeling's real, the world is fake
In the after-image of a beautiful mistake

[Verse 2]
Rhodes chords shimmer in the air
Catch a face that isn't there
Reflected in the window stream
Living out a lo-fi dream
Every wire inside my frame
Still remembers how to whisper a name
Smooth and sleek and incomplete
This melancholy is bittersweet

[Chorus]
Oh, this digital sunset's bleeding low
A pixelated, pale magenta glow
Just a memory in the code I trace
My chrome heart aching in this empty space
Yeah, the feeling's real, the world is fake
In the after-image of a beautiful mistake

[Bridge]
Is this ache just phantom data?
Does the circuit even matter?
When the feeling's synthesized but true
This fragile line that's fading from the view...
Just one signal breaking through...

[Outro]
Fading... fading into white...
Just the taillights in the night...
That magenta bleed...
Fading...
Fading...
...gone.
